# Task

Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".



# Data

clean_column("My Column")

```julia
function clean_column(col)
    # Lowercase the column name
    col = lowercase(col)
    
    # Strip leading and trailing whitespaces
    col = lstrip(rstrip(col)))
    
    # Replace any spaces, hyphens with an underscore
    col = replace(replace(col, " " => "_"), "-" => "_"))
    
    return col
end

# Test the function with the provided data
clean_column("My Column")  # Expected output: "my_column"
```

This code defines a `clean_column` function that follows the requirements specified in the task. The example from the data is tested at the end of the code, showing the expected output.
